ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I have learned the basics of Italian and feel confident reading, writing, and speaking elementary Italian.
An in-depth knowledge of the Italian language, geography, and culture.
I learned basic Italian grammar and vocabulary and parts of Italian culture.
I learned so much in one semester of this class. I am able to formulate full sentences in Italian in multiple tenses. I also learned a little about Italian food and culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength of this course is its format and weightingthe way the assignments and tests are weighted allows for students to succeed while still making mistakes every now and then. This is especially true in the test policy (your lowest test grade gets dropped). The only weakness is the often tedious homework each day.

There are many strengths including the professor, assignments, and intensive HW that enhances engagement in my opinion. Another strength is Friday asynchronous option. Only weakness is VHL is expensive.
I believe there could be more projects and homework compared to the amount of tests.

I think that the classes themselves were very helpful and intriguing. I never found myself bored. The class was designed so one bad test score would not discourage me and I felt motivated to keep up with the content. A weakness is that more material and practice could be provided for review prior to tests.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would 100% recommend this course. The Italian department at Yale is truly amazingall the professors are so kind and helpful, and the events for students are fun and engaging. Ive had an amazing time in my Italian class and have met some truly fantastic people along the way.
If the student is truly passionate about learning Italian then definitely yes.
Yes, I enjoyed this class and believe Italian is not a hard language to learn.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student because it is an engaging and fun class to fill a language requirement or for interest.
